sen.j: 典座（てんぞ）は禅宗寺院の役職の一つ。
sen.e: Tenzo is one of the positions in Zen temples.
Tenzo is one of the positions in a Zen temple.

sen.j: 六知事（ろくちじ）の第五位。
sen.e: It is the fifth position of the rokuchiji ("six officers" of a Zen monastery)
It's the fifth position of the rokuchiji ("six officers" of a Zen monastery)

sen.j: 禅宗寺院で修行僧の食事、仏や祖師への供膳をつかさどる役職。
sen.e: Tenzo is a position in charge of cooking meal for ascetic monks and serving trays of offering for Buddha statues and the founder of the sect.
Tenzo is a position in charge of cooking meals for ascetic monks, as well as of serving trays of offerings for Buddha statues and the founder of the sect.

sen.j: 一般に炊事係は「飯炊き」「裏方」などと呼ばれ低く見られがちであるが、禅宗寺院では食事の調理、喫飯も重要な修行の一つとされ、また陰徳（人知れず徳行を積むこと）を行ずる立場であることから重要な役職とされる。
sen.e: Although cooks may be called as background job and looked down in general society, cook is regarded as an important position in Zen temples because cooking and eating meal are also regarded as important trainings, and cook is a position which can do intoku (do good in secret without expecting reward).
sen.cmt: 「飯炊き」は、うまく差別的に訳せませんでした。
sen.e: Although people in general society may look down upon the cook and think of the work as a background job, the position of cook is considered important in Zen temples because cooking and eating meals are also regarded as important aspects of training, and the cook is a position that can do intoku (do good in secret without expecting a reward).

sen.j: 修行経験が深く篤実温厚な人物が任命される場合が多く、修行僧たちの相談役として敬慕される者が多いという。
sen.e: It is said that an experienced, sincere and well-tempered person is often appointed as tenzo and many tenzos are adored from monks as advisers.
It is said that an experienced, sincere and well-tempered person is often appointed as the tenzo, and that many tenzos are highly prized as advisers to monks.

sen.j: 曹洞宗では開祖道元が求法のため宋 (王朝)で修業した際、二人の老典座との出会いから禅の修行の本質を悟ったという故事がある。
sen.e: There was a historical event told in the Soto sect that when the founder Dogen was training in Song for seeking the teaching of Buddhism, he met with two tenzos and got recognized the essence of the Zen training.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Soto sect tells of a historical event in which, when the founder Dogen was training in Song to seek the teaching of Buddhism, he met with two tenzos and thereupon recognized the essence of the Zen training.

The Soto sect tells of a historical event in which, when the founder Dogen was training in Song (Dynasty) to seek the teaching of Buddhism, he met with two tenzos and thereupon recognized the essence of the Zen training.

sen.j: このことから特に尊重されている。
sen.e: The Soto sect has a tradition based on this event that tenzo is especially respected.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thus it's traditional in the Soto sect that the position of tenzo is highly respected, based on this event.
